Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

job title: Site Manager for Road, Canal, Drainage, Dam Construction: (Depend on ability after interview)
position: Site Manager for Road, Canal, Drainage, Dam Construction: (Depend on ability after interview)
Job Description:
** Salary Rank: 600$ to 900$ (Probation period)
** Can work at province 

** Duties and Responsibilities:
• Setting out site camp and office
• Organize technical staff and labors in each task clearly and correctly 
• Analyze and consult with the employer and contractor on the future plan 
• Arrange the work in order so as not to be clumsy and slower than the schedule set in the contract 
• Encourage and motivate staff and workers to complete the work on time 
• Clear understanding of how to implement high quality road, irrigation and structure work 
• Coordinate with subordinates when there is conflict or dispute.
• Review weekly and monthly report on the status and progress of the contracts, including project costs and potential changes.
• Provides technical support to Project Managers.
• Re-surveys, including the shape, contour, location, elevation, and dimensions of land or land features;
• Monitoring and inspecting work undertaken by subordinate
• Strong mental and practical strategy that makes staff motivated to work hard.
• Highly responsible for assigning and handling work on site.
• Understand the working situation what techniques, equipment, staff to use in such a situation.
• Be aware of situations that may arise from experience to find ways to prevent in advance.
Job Requirement:
- Minimum Educational Level Required: Bachelor's Degree (Civil Engineering) or equivalent degree (If have, Priority)
- Languages Required: English: Very Good in Construction Sector, (Necessary)

** Other Requirements
Program related to Survey skills (If have, Priority)
• Years of experience: 2-5 Years’ Experience with related work in construction (Necessary)
• Good in using MS. Office (esp. MS. Excel) and AutoCAD 2D, Advance Concrete, Civil Structure, (If have, Priority)
• Intermediate knowledge of drawing understanding, (Necessary)
• Be honest, punctual, hard-working, patient, and flexible, (Necessary)

** Additional by Company
• Accommodation + Office Site
• Transportation

Job Description:
PEOPLE MANAGEMENT
• To act as a role model for the management of the store team.
• To organise and distribute tasks and positions to each member of the team.
• To To participate in the recruitment of personnel in an active and optimal manner.
• To ensure the development of the team towards a high level of knowledge and performance.
• To ensure a good level of customer service in the team.
• To detect the potential of each employee and ensure their development.
• To ensure the optimal management of personnel administration duties.
• To monitor and ensure the correct personal and professional image of the team.
• To lead the team and correctly and actively manage potential conflict.
• To ensure compliance with the regulations and the legislation.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT
• To plan the required measures to reach targets.
• To analyze and review management indicators and costs in order to improve them.
• To continuously monitor sales and customer service.
• To priorities and, during busy periods, dedicate time to direct selling alongside the team.
• To ensure the correct execution of administrative tasks.
• To review and apply all instructions received (HQ, supervisor, etc.).
• To ensure strict supervision of the entire cash desk procedure.
• To optimize resources and try to minimize expenses e.g. optimization of the workforce, suppliers, etc.

PRODUCT AND MERCHANDISING
• To be familiar with the collection and maximise sales (initial order, entries, etc.)
• To ensure and collaborate in the implementation of Merchandising standards.
• To optimise selling space in order to obtain maximum profitability.
• To continuously ensure the correct replenishment of the store.
• To ensure compliance with merchandising and furniture display guidelines.
• To produce stylings, silhouettes and combinations on a regular basis.
• To control and manage stock (both in transit and in the stockroom) and inventories.
• To ensure the correct end of season return (inventories).
• To ensure compliance with the store image, maintenance and window dressing standards.
• To provide product feedback (his/hers and customers’).
Job Requirement:
• Analysis of management indicators.
• Customer Service Standard and Service Policy.
• Knowledge of the collection and awareness of fashion.
• Merchandising Standards.
• Cash register program and Pathfinder operation.
• E Leadership qualities – mobilizes and motivates the team.
• Product awareness and commercial orientation.
• Organization, management and planning.
• Able to analyze and offer solutions.
• Customer and image-oriented.
• Shows initiative and decision-making/problem-solving ability.
• Acts quickly and is multi-disciplinary.
• Is enthusiastic, friendly, cordial and polite.
• Prioritization – optimal use of time.
• Self-motivating and self-critical.
Attachments
Company Profile:
Since starting out in 1947, Jaspal Group has substantially diversified from import home linen distribution to a highly diversified textile driven conglomerate with interests in manufacturing, trading, retailing and real estate. The Group is known for a range of products from sophisticated to chic
ranging from men & ladies fashion, bags, fashion accessories to lifestyle home fashion and bedding
products for better living.

One of the most successful companies under Jaspal Group is Jaspal Company Limited, the top leading fashion retail company in Thailand engaging in designing, manufacturing, and marketing of several clothing and accessories brands. With over 2,350 professional staff and a network of 350
shops and corners all over Thailand, the Company has also proclaimed its reputation across Asian markets, as well as other major cities in the world.

Jaspal Group has stepped forward to expand its business to Cambodia under the name of Jaspal Fashions (Cambodia) Co., Ltd. and introduced four stores namely Jelly Bunny, Lyn, Lyn Around and CC-OO to AEON Mall, Phnom Penh. We are now ready to take a new challenge to introduce more stores to AEON Mall 2.

In this occasion, we are pleased to invite the qualified candidates who are passionate about fashion to join us and become a part of the greater success.
Contact Info: Contact Information Mr. Chin Panha  N/A kh-hr@jpsfashions.com Chip Mong 271 Mega Mall (Phnom Penh) N/A

Job Description:
The Senior Sales Associate is responsible for providing warm welcome, effective presentation and demonstration of products and with a high level of service to customers in order to satisfy their shopping needs and enhance their shopping experience.

RESPONSIBILITIES
• Achieve sales target as assigned by the Company
• Follow the company guideline and operational standard
• Replenish products on shelf and participate in stock count
• Maintain good housekeeping conditions in the store
• Maintain well-presented visual merchandise and displays
• Provide excellent customer service and product knowledge to customers
• Assist in opening and closing of the store
• Assist in cashiering duties when required
• Assist and support in-store marketing events
Job Requirement:
REQUIREMENT
• Min. high school degree or higher in any field
• At least 1 year experience in fashion retail or service industry
• Pleasant, neat, warm and friendly personality
• Service-oriented with strong selling and customer service skills
• Strong interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
• Confident, honest, enthusiastic and a good team player
• Responsible, patient and motivated with positive work attitude
• Computer literate is an added advantage
• Good in spoken English to liaise with the superiors and serve international customers
• Commit to work on shift, long hours, weekends, and Public Holidays as needed
• Able to work at CHIP MONG 271 MEGA MALL

Job Description:
PEOPLE MANAGEMENT
• To organise and distribute tasks and positions to each member of the team.
• To communicate actively with the team, according to requirements.
• To ensure a good level of customer service in the team.
• To participate in the recruitment of store personnel and learn to do it on your own.
• To actively collaborate in the correct integration of all new employees
• To detect the potential of each employee and mentor them in their development.
• To support with the effective management of personnel administration duties.
• To monitor and ensure the correct personal and professional image of the team.
• Wherever necessary, to manage potential conflict in the correct manner.
• To ensure compliance with the regulations and the legislation.

BUSINESS MANAGEMENT
• To actively participate in planning the required measures in order to meet targets.
• To analyse management indicators and costs in order to improve them.
• To continuously monitor sales and customer service.
• During busy periods, to dedicate time to direct selling alongside the team.
• To supervise and apply administrative procedures according to the internal regulations.
• To apply all instructions received (HQ, supervisor, etc.) and report on them (if necessary).
• To carry out strict supervision of the entire cash desk procedure.
• To participate in the optimisation of internal resources and try to minimise expenses e.g.
optimisation of the workforce, suppliers, etc.
• To communicate and pass on any information that may affect sales.

PRODUCT AND MERCHANDISING
• To be familiar with the collection and maximise sales (initial order, entries, etc.).
• To participate in the implementation of Merchandising standards.
• To know the profitability of the store and furniture displays in order to maximise sales.
• To be familiar with and apply the replenishing standards of the store.
• To respect and monitor compliance with merchandising and furniture display guidelines.
• To produce stylings, silhouettes and combinations on a regular basis.
• To control and manage stock (both in transit and in the stockroom) and inventories.
• To ensure the correct end of season return (inventories).
• To ensure compliance with the store image, maintenance and window dressing standards.
• To provide product feedback (his/hers and customers’).
Job Requirement:
• Basic knowledge of the business indicators.
• Customer Service Standard and Service Policy.
• Knowledge of the collection and awareness of fashion.
• Merchandising Standards.
• Cash register programme and Pathfinder operation.
• Internal regulations and some knowledge of employment legislation.
• Product awareness and commercial orientation.
• Organisation, management and planning.
• Able to analyse and offer solutions.
• A motivator with leadership qualities.
• Communicative and persuasive.
• Customer and image-oriented.
• Ability to adapt – energy and speed.
• Is enthusiastic, friendly, cordial and polite.
• Shows initiative and decision-making/problem-solving ability.
• Acts quickly and is multi-disciplinary.

Job Description:
1.  Preparing MEP tenders for clients as required
2.  Review the tender documents to evaluate the scope of the project and provide recommendations to the direct manager accordingly.
3.  Discussing, drafting, reviewing and negotiating the terms of business contracts
4.  Making sure construction projects meet agreed technical standards
5.  Read the contracts conditions carefully to take it into consideration when preparing the tender. 
6.  Distribute tasks among the team members and monitor their performance.
7.  Contact the suppliers, subcontractors and clients when needed to facilitate the tendering process to meet the timeline.
8.  Conduct site visits with the clients when needed to show them the ongoing projects or see their sites.
9.  Review the direct and indirect cost sheets in addition to the top sheet and make the needed amendments in coordination with the Tender Team Leader and Tender Engineer.
10.  Review the Technical file after collecting the needed documents to be sent to the client to understand the organization’s capabilities.
11.  Manage the process of handing over the project documents and requirements to the operations team.
12.  Lead, supervise and coach the tendering team and give them the needed support when needed.
13. Other tasks assigned by manager
Job Requirement:
1.  Bachelor’s degree of MEP Engineer or Equivalent
2.  Experience at 3 years in this role 
3.  Computer skill such as Microsoft Word, Excel, AutoCAD and Power point
4.  Can communication in English (reading, writing and speaking)
5.  Problem solving skill
6.  Excellent organizational and leadership skills.
7.  Outstanding communication and interpersonal abilities

Job Description: - Ensuring that the company’s stock level meet business needs.- Overseeing the purchasing and pricing report, replenishing levels when necessary, and monitoring stock in/out or internal transfer between departments within one business enterprise.- Coordinating stock control operation with warehouse staff, as well as the sales and finance department. - Analyzing the supply chain data to ensure the uninterrupted availability of stock.- Forecasting supply and demand to prevent overstocking and running out-of-stock. - Evaluate vendors and supplier’s offers and negotiating profitable purchase prices.  - Placing and receiving orders to replenish stocks as needed. - Overseeing stock storage processes, including tagging, code, boxing, and labelling. - Maintaining a steady flow of stock from storage to where it is needed. - Performing regular inventory audits and keeping stock purchasing within budget. - Prepare report daily, weekly, monthly to line manager.- Perform other duties as assigned by line manager.
Job Requirement: - Bachelor degree in accounting and management or related fields. - Minimum 1 or 2 years in experience.- Good knowledge in English (Reading, Writing, and Listening).- Good knowledge in PC (Word, Excel, Power Point, Internet and Email).- Be able to work spare shift if any require.- Knowledge in stock controlling skill.- Good communication and problem-solving skill.- Be honest and heard working.How to apply!Submit your CVs to our Talent Acquisition Team (TAT), Via email to: hr@mjqeducation.edu.kh  Telegram: https://t.me/HRMJQETel: (855) 12 797 939, (855) 93 335 564
Company Profile:
Mengly J. Quach Education (MJQE) is known as a unique education system for its superior quality, discipline and services. It is remarkably consistent with the use creative, innovative, and critical thinking to make a difference for our young generations. We are always optimistic that our standard system will surly provide the best education for our kids and help shape their life to act with respect towards themselves.

MJQE is in a restructuring period of change. MJQE focuses its efforts to ensure all students have the academic and personal skills required to succeed in college and life. Currently, MJQE is one of the 4 companies in the MJQ Group (MJQ Education, Prasethpheap Finance, MJQ Travel and the Mengly J. Quach Media Network (MMN)). MJQ Education has 4 school-companies (Aii Language Center (Aii), American Intercon School (AIS), Go Overseas Study Overseas (SOGO) and i-Learn). There are 7 campuses of Aii and 8 campuses of AIS throughout Cambodia serving more than 17,000 students with more than 500,000 alumni since 2005. 

The MJQE is committed to building talented and committed students and providing the appropriate supports to schools to ensure all students can be successful.

MJQE is an Equal Opportunity Employer. MJQE ensures equal employment opportunities regardless of race, creed, sex, color, national origin, religion, age, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, political affiliation, marital status or other human differences. MJQE has a policy of active recruitment of qualified minority employees.
Our Benefits:
Competitive salary 
- Scholarship for employee, employee's children, and spouse 
- NSSF and 24 - hour worldwide accident insurance 
- Maternity, paternity, and marriage benefits
- Benefits as compliance to Prakas of Ministry of Labor and Vocational Training 
- Career advancement opportunities 
- Training opportunities for professional development 
- Annual salary increment based on experience and performance review.

Job Description:
JOB PURPOSE	
This position will control, oversee and manage part of the supply chain including: logistic, shipping, import and service-related activities. He/she is fully responsible for the trading, operational, planning and logistic department.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
• Negotiation of imported materials with emphasis on demand and supply planning and delivery scheduling of cargos and daily interface with the authorities. 
• Cross train in all areas, including demand and supply forecast and delivery scheduling, inventory management, shipping, system and procedure development.
• Make adjustments to cargo forecasts delivery schedule and nominations based on operational circumstances. Communicate cargo forecast and schedule adjustments with the relevant internal and 3rd parties. 
• Actively monitor, maintain, analyse daily and monthly reports and reconcile and settle final inventory entries. 
•	Assist with developing and documenting other purchasing policies and procedures as well as the related software tools which are used in the Logistic Department.
• Selecting carriers and negotiating contracts and rates.
• Planning and monitoring inbound and outgoing deliveries.
• Organizing warehouse, label goods, plot routes, and process shipments.
• Responding to any issues or complaints.
• Researching ideal shipping techniques, routing, and carriers.
• Working day by day with other BUs to incorporate logistics with department procedures and operations.
• Evaluating budgets and expenditures.
• Updating and evaluating metrics to assess performance and implement enhancements.
• Ensuring all operations adhere to laws, guidelines.
• Keeping shipping operations within budget without compromising speed or efficiency.
• Processing shipment documentation and inspecting completed orders.
• Creating and implementing shipping policies and procedures.
• Training, and supervising logistic employees.
• Any other tasks assign by Deputy CEO.

ORGANIZATION RELATIONSHIPS
• Reports directly to the Deputy CEO, coordinates all importation and taxation activities for the business units under CMED Group.
Job Requirement:
• Bachelor degree or above in Logistics or Supply Chain field.
• 3+ years of Cargo Scheduling experience
• 3+ years of demand and supply planning and scheduling
• Knowledge of Cargo/Shipping/Logistic policies and procedures
• Be confident, assertive and independent.
• Excellent communication and negotiation skill.
• Critical thinker and problem-solving skills
• Good time-management and interpersonal skills
• Hands on experience in budgeting and reporting
• Good command of speaking, reading and writing in English.
• Be able to travel.

Company Profile:
RMA entered the Cambodian market in 1992 as an exclusive provider of dedicated system solutions for commercial and non-commercial enterprises in the sectors of infrastructure, energy and logistics. Gradually, the company has been growing alongside the development of Cambodia and expanded to automotive, agricultural and heavy equipment, warehouse solutions, financial services, car rental and food franchise management.  In addition to business expansion, RMA Cambodia has also focused its attention on human resources by providing internships and employment opportunities to approximately 2,000 local and professional staff with a number of expatriates working together to share their skills and expertise.

RMA Cambodia has also been very active within local communities. We consistently work with local authorities and organizations to provide financial and technical assistance in essential key sectors, such as health, environment, education and sports.

We aim to help Cambodia grow and prosper.

OUR SERVICES AND PRODUCTS:

RMA Cambodia and its affiliate Asia Vehicle Rental (AVR) are offering franchised car rental services through the global brand AVIS. Rentals are customized with brand-new Ford vehicles and experienced English-speaking chauffeurs. AVIS also offers car rental and leasing that meets all types of customers requirements for business trips, leisure or field work, with or without chauffeurs.

RMA Cambodia has a financing arm, RMA Financial Services, offers financing solutions to flexibly meet the needs of corporate and retail customers for the purchase of their own automotive and heavy equipment, agricultural machinery and warehouse solution equipment.

RMA Cambodia is also a provider of heavy equipment products and solutions in construction, road building and maintenance, and agriculture, namely JCB, Mitsubishi FUSO and John Deere. RMA Cambodia is an agent for the world’s leading brands in these industries.

Job Description:
* Video Editor is responded with taking the raw footage shot by a film crew and director and turning it into the final product. This means following an outline, script or shot list and assembling the footage into one cohesive video or film. Often in video and film work, there are many camera angles and takes recorded. It is the responsibility of the Video Editor to review all the footage and create the best output by cutting and connecting various footage, adding sound effects and graphics and fine-tuning the completed video or film.

* Duties and Responsibilities:
1.	Assembling raw footage and editing videos.
2.	Following a script, screenplay or outline
3.	Inputting sound to enhance footage, which may include selecting music and writing voice-overs
4.	Inputting graphics to enhance footage
5.	Digitally splicing film and video and synchronizing them into one rough cut file
6.	Improving and correcting lighting, coloring and faulty footage
7.	Working closely with directors to present a final product that matches his or her vision
8.	Perform other tasks assigned by line manager.
Job Requirement:
1.	A Bachelor’s degree in multimedia or related field
2.	At least 1-2 years of experience in similar position
3.	Proficiency in editing software programs 
4.	Be creative and understand with kind of films
5.	Willing to travel (based on actual project)
6.	Attention to details, quick thinker, intelligent and articulate
7.	Be industrial, flexible, helpful, honesty, and good attitude.
Contact Info: Contact Information PAKK Seyha  078 415 333/086 777 439 jobs@lyhourleasing.com #243-244, St. 598, Toul Sangke, Khan Russey Keo, Phnom Penh. 078 415 333/086 777 439

Job Description: • Tracking customer experiences across online and offline channels, devices, and touchpoints• Identifying customer needs and taking proactive steps to maintain positive experiences• Analyzing customer feedback on product ranges and new releases, as well as preparing reports• Performing product tests, evaluating support services, and facilitating improvements• Documenting processes and logging technical issues, as well as customer compliments and complaints• Informing customers about new product features and functionalities.
Job Requirement: • Verbal and written communication skills in English• Solid knowledge of online customer engagement platforms and channels• At least 3 years experience as a customer experience specialist or similar customer support role• Extensive experience in gathering and interpreting customer experience information• Great organizational and time management abilities• Experience working in international environments and globally distributed teams.
Company Profile: MVL is a blockchain-based mobility company that started in 2018 that aims to build a reliable mobility ecosystem by recording data through innovative blockchain technology. Starting as a vehicle ride-hailing platform company under the name TADA, we have a business model that increases the application of blockchain technology through each new service we build.ONiON Mobility, a subsidiary of MVL, provides electric vehicles and related infrastructure mainly in Cambodia. TADA, another subsidiary, provides ride-hailing services mainly in Singapore, Cambodia and Vietnam and is building a mobility ecosystem by improving the profit structure of drivers through a new model that is completely different from existing companies.ONiON Mobility is actively conducting business in Cambodia by launching the T1, an eco-friendly version of the three-wheeled passenger vehicle “Tuk-Tuk”. We have established an EV factory to mass-produce our T1’s, and are operating electric vehicle charging stations all over the city of Phnom Penh. In addition to expanding our business throughout Cambodia, we are expanding our business to overseas regions by diversifying our product lineup, including the T1c for eco-friendly cargo transportation and eco-friendly bikes. In particular, the T1 provides a mileage of more than 100km and is an eco-friendly vehicle that does not have the inconvenience of long charging times by adopting a battery exchange method instead. ONiON has gained popularity in the local market by reducing maintenance costs of our E Tuk-Tuk’s by about 40% of the normal internal combustion vehicles because there is no need of frequent replacement of parts and high oil price. In addition, ONiON Mobility plans to collect and utilize all data generated from vehicles and stations for efficient operation and management at the MVL group level as well as to share the benefits to all the participants in the ecosystem created by MVL.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR  010 656 242 sokhim.pek@onionev.com Phnom Penh HQ: , #93B, St590, Vllage13, Sangkat Boeng kok, Toul Kork, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 010 656 242

Job Description: • Planning Function    - Setting sales targets and sales budgets on Annually > Quarterly > Monthly > Weekly > Daily basis in alignment with overall company targets    - Enquiry / Lead generation planning to achieve sales targets    - Prepare sales incentive scheme based on target achievement• Sales Function    - Drive sales team members to achieve individual targets    - Deliver revenue and gross margins    - Develop sales pipeline for monthly sales for current and new vehicles    - Manage Sale Showroom(s)    - Demonstrate product to customers as required    - Plan and execute sales activities to drive sales    - Clear knowledge and understanding of sales process    - Create and maintain daily sales reports• Partner Management    - Finance / Bank Partners : Work with finance / bank partner teams to implement loan schemes for customers    - Govt & Agency Partners : Work with Govt and Agency Partners (for ex: Vehicle Registration) to ensure compliance with laws, rules and regulations    - Resellers / 2nd Hand Dealers : Identify, recruit and manager resellers / 2nd Head dealers to develop 2nd hand market for vehicle• Customer Management    - Ability to close sales with customers    - Ability to handle customer complaints and resolve them    - Develop good understanding and relationship with all customers• Rental Program Management    - Develop, operate and manage vehicle rental program• Team Management    - Recruit , Manage, Train sales team    - Support team in closing sales and achieving monthly targets    - Roster planning including for public holidays• Reporting    - Report to the head of Sales and Marketing team, and CEO when necessary
Job Requirement: • Minimum of 5-6 years of sales manager experience• Experience in the 3 wheeler industry is highly preferred• Experience in 2 wheeler , Agri Machinery(Tractors) industry or Auto Industry is desirable• Excellent written and verbal skills in English and Khmer• Compensation : Salary + Incentive based on target achievement• Working Hours : 6 days working

Job Description: •	Ensures safe working in mechanical maintenance (is accountable).•	Ensures mechanical maintenance delivers on time in full (OTIF) and with the required quality •	Leads the mechanical maintenance according to Planned Maintenance Program.•	Drives asset performance and manages, monitors and analyses the maintenance costs.•	Responsible for Effectiveness of breakdown support teams (MTTR).•	Informs plant manager of major breakdowns.•	Responsible for the maintenance RCFA process.•	Hands over project deliverables to PM teams (troubleshooting guides).•	Defines and trains BDA, MSA (minor stops analysis), RCFA (5 why) methodology.•	Ensures warranties process is followed•	Approves procurement of parts and services (mechanical)•	Supports strategic supplier management and evaluation.•	Establish and execute the Long (3YP) and medium (annual overhauls) maintenance master plan.•	Supports and improves Predictive Maintenance.•	Accountable for performance and technical development (incl. performance reviews) of entire mechanical maintenance organization.•	Manages workforce and capacity in mechanical maintenance, including training and out/in sourcing.•	Aligns planned maintenance stoppage with production stakeholders i.e. brewing and packaging managers (and reports to Engineering manager/ Plant manager).•	Accountable for all interfaces within maintenance and between the maintenance department and other departments within the brewery.•	Represents Maintenance in the Production Meetings.•	Defines and drives the maintenance strategy; i.e. installing required foundation organization, setting up the strategic maintenance plan, establishing basic standards, restoring all equipment to basic condition •	Establishes the functional competency of the mechanical maintenance (and operations) team in the use of basic maintenance systems and tools.•	Implements the management system and ensures the SAP or other CMMS in functional and in place•	Governs asset- and spare parts master data (is accountable).•	Monitors the maintenance KPI dashboard and uses this to report and control the maintenance department.
Job Requirement: •	Education: Minimum Bachelor, preferably MSc degree in Mechanical Engineering and/or similar.•	Experiences:  a.	>4 years management experience, preferably in a technical/operational surrounding.b.	Proven track record in people management (getting things done within a group/team).c.	Ambassador for enabling a safe and quality controlled working environment (leads by example). d.	Minimum of 4 years experiences & knowledge of maintenance (engineering) and/or operations, also from a strategic point of view: ability to setup and drive (strategic) improvement initiatives and manage changes from the shop floor within the department.e.	Enabler to effectively work together between different directly related departments (i.e. procurement, operations, finance).•	Skills: a.	Focused on and experienced in managing and controlling the 6 core work processes within maintenance; i.e. workflow (maintenance job life cycle) management, maintenance engineering, materials & parts supply, inventory management, asset master data management and cost management.b.	Ample working experience with CMMS i.e. SAP and others. Ability to support, manage and coach the ME (master data owner) in properly setting up the required master data structure and preventive maintenance regime within the SAP system. c.	Experienced in conducting BDA-analysis and training other BDA facilitators; i.e. good training skills.d.	Excellent communication-, management-, facilitation- and reporting skills. e.	Ability to effectively show/visualize the added value of maintenance (foundation) activities in relation to improving maintenance performance (can explain the required strategy to the team and other departments and create buy-in). f.	Ample knowledge of TPM and (other) continuous improvement methods.

job title: Mechanical Engineering Technician I ( Angk Snoul )
position: Mechanical Engineering Technician I ( Angk Snoul )
Job Description: • Evaluate design drawings for new or changed tools by measuring dimensions on the drawings and comparing them with the original specifications• Prepare layouts and drawings of parts to be made and of the process for putting the parts together, often using three-dimensional design software• Discuss changes with coworkers—for example, in the design of a part and in the way it will be made and assembled• Review instructions and blueprints for projects in order to ensure that test specifications and procedures are followed and objectives are metPlan, produce, and assemble new or changed mechanical parts for products, such as industrial machinery or equipment• Set up and conduct tests of complete units and their components, and record results• Compare test results with design specifications and with test objectives and make recommendations for changes in products or in test methods• Estimate labor costs, equipment life, and plant space

job title: Supervisor- Health Safety Environmental ( Angk Snoul )
position: Supervisor- Health Safety Environmental ( Angk Snoul )
Job Description: Job Summary: To develop, communicate and drive an effective and coordinated safety compliance process. He/she needs to advise the HB management on both best practices as well as any legislative changes. He/She will contribute to the success of the company by promoting a culture of continuous improvement and ensuring the effectiveness of safety management systems across the company.Duties and Responsibilities:• Develop and implement SHE and Security operations, policies, procedures, and training to ensure compliance with HB operations, policies, and procedures.• Identify strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, risks, vulnerabilities, and threats to safety and security in the development of appropriate safety and security strategy.• Oversee the performance of a facility, special program, contract, divisional, and all other security personnel.• Manage the investigation and correction of all security compliance issues• Lead investigations, audits, and security inspections.• Provide budget information and assist in forecasting requirements• Ensure the proper operation and maintenance of special programs as assigned by top management.• Prepare and analyze reports for cost-saving, forecasting, and planning, for SHE and Security budget.• Serve on committees and boards related to SHE and security.• Hire, train, evaluate, and lead all security staff and organization personnel with security duties• Lead SHE team and security efforts in planning, implementation, threat detection, risk mitigation, and response• Benchmark with other organizations to utilize best practices and principles in the area of security and risk management• Oversee the investigation and correction of all SHE and security issues• Manage investigations, compliance audits, and security inspections by government agencies• Provide leadership and expertise to operational committees responsible for safety and security• Providing to third parties, contractors, and sub-contractor about SHE guidelines and evaluation during implementation onsite.• To develop and communicate SHE standards, give guidance and define performance measures to support HB’s safety and engineering compliance strategy by developing a safety improvement plan and implementing internationally recognized safety standards as well as Cambodian legislation.• To audit and appraise the safety management systems across all HB functions to ensure compliance against ISO- standards, company corporate governance, and legal requirements.• To develop, encourage and promote a positive safety culture within all areas of the company through management, communication, and chairing of the safety team.• To use process optimization and business tools (e.g. TPM) to ensure knowledge and best practices are shared and trained by all staff.• To work closely with the medical team and HR to ensure continuous improvement in the overall health of HB’s employees.
Job Requirement: • Bachelor's degree in Engineering or Chemistry or (Exact) Sciences, Higher• Minimum 5-7 years of experience in a production environment• Good understanding of international safety requirements and possibly management• Demonstrated ability to work across different teams• Strong oral and written• Good planning and organizational skills.• Fluent in writing & speaking in English and Khmer• Fluent with Word, Excel, and power-point• Good communication skills• Disciplined• Open-minded and adapt to changing• Good coaching skills

Company Profile:
Cambodia Beverage Company Ltd (CBC) referred too locally as Coca-Cola Cambodia is a leading manufacturer & distributor of non-alcoholic ready to drink (NARTD) beverages throughout Cambodia. With our state-of-the-art bottling plant (commissioned in 2016) situated within PPSEZ, one of the leading Economic Zones in Phnom Penh.

The company produces 16 different beverages, under 8 brands, and within 5 different NARTD categories (Sparkling, Tea, Energy, Water, and Isotonic) which is supplied to our customers throughout the Kingdom.
CBC directly employs more than 850 staff while creating indirect employment opportunities for another 8,000+ staff across the Kingdom.

We are proud that >99.7% of our workforce are Cambodian nationals and that >31% of our staff are female, with women making up 37% of the senior management team. We are committed to increasing our female diversity and are targeting to have 50% female staff by 2030.
We are committed to integrating sustainability into everything we do.

By 2030 we aim to collect and recycle a bottle or can for each one we sell by 2030 and use at least 50% recycled material in our packaging.
We are committed to return to nature and communities 100%+ of the water we use in our drinks and their production. We are working to increase water security where we operate, source ingredients, and touch people's lives.
Contact Info: Contact Information TALENT ACQUISITION TEAM  010 325 777 / 096 48 99 677 / 096 355 6214 / 012 916 444 hrd@coca-cola.com.kh No.287, National Road 5, Mittapheap Village, Russey Keo District, Phnom Penh,  Kingdom of Cambodia. 010 325 777 / 096 48 99 677 / 096 355 6214 / 012 916 444

Job Description: •	To compile the orders and consult with Demand Planning Manager on Sales Forecast to aligned with the S&OP Processes.•	To collaborate with Sales Regions, Finance, Warehouse, Distributors and Logistic to ensure the orders and deliveries are aligned with “Just in Time with Full” standard.•	Committed, Realistic, Integrated and Team player to contribute to the Business Plans and Strategies. •	To understand the Business-Wide implication and having the focus throughout the Value Chain studies and apply it to the Distribution Schedule Planning processes.•	To identify the changes within the Business and translate it to the information and Data for decision making for Distribution Planning Processes.•	To identify actions and alternative plans to manage the changes and derive the Gaps closing plan and proposal as the output.•	To collaborate with the Sales team to Implement and monitor the Distribution Management 5 pillars standard at all distributors.•	To develop the 5 pillars scorecard for each distributor, to identify the gap and implement the action plan to close the gap.•	To develop, monitor and measure the Distributor Incentive scheme.•	To provide best option to Management to make decision to respond to the changes and optimize the business plans.•	Tracking, monitoring, and updating the Distribution Schedule to provide the input to the S&OP processes on the weekly basis.•	People Development o	Lean to Improve behavior.o	Identify and propose training for self and team members for improvements.
Job Requirement: •	Preferably a minimum of 5 years in a FMCG environment with at least 2 years’ experience in Sales Operational, Logistic or Supply Chain management role.•	Having experience in Logistic or Supply Chain is highly preferred.•	Integrity, Self-Discipline, Trustworthy and reliable.•	Proficiency written and spoken in English.•	Excellent communication skills (interpersonal/Reporting/Microsoft Office)•	Solid analytical, Planning and Organizing skills.•	Excellent business acumen and a good understanding of the market with entrepreneurial zest.•	Self-starter mindset, Self-Confident, good work Ethic, Assertive, Effective, Positive and Energetic Attitude.•	Must be Systematic person capable of cooperating across the functions.•	Ability to communicate clearly - Decent presentations skills.•	Strong Leadership skills, Team-orientation, and ability to coach the team.•	Action-oriented, persistent and result oriented.
Company Profile: Hanuman Beverages is the Cambodian beverage master who commits to creating best-in-class beverages that innovate new tastes for the Cambodian people. With an investment of over 160 million US dollars, creating direct and indirect employments for over 1,000 people whilst supporting thousands more external stakeholders, Hanuman Beverages is committed to contributing to the economic growth of Cambodia. With our passion, we will be sure to make a positive mark on the beverage industry in Cambodia.

Company Profile:
Cambodia Airports develops and manages Cambodia’s network of international airports located in Phnom Penh, Siem Reap, and Sihanoukville. Its teams plan and design the development of airport infrastructure, build and maintain the facilities, handle commercial activities and provides services to stakeholders, including The Royal Government of Cambodia, passengers, airlines, and tenants.

Since its inception in 1995, Cambodia Airports has generated immense economic and social benefits for Cambodia by connecting the country to the world. Its leadership in airport development and operations translates in advanced working environment, staff benefit, and Corporate Social Responsibility policies.

Company Profile:
COGETEL Ltd. (ONLINE) is the leading ISP and broadband provider in the country; established in July 1997 by Telstra
Cambodia as Bigpond Cambodia – the first commercial Internet Service Provider in the country. In 2002, Cogetel Limited acquired the business from Telstra marking the beginning of its ADSL service and its new brand name – ONLINE.

ONLINE subsequently brought in WiMAX, Long-range WiFi, and Fiber Optic to increase its range of last miles technology to meet any need of its customers.

ONLINE strives to deliver products and services that are tailored to its customers’ Internet technology needs, easily understood and used, delivered with warmth, knowledge and experience throughout the years. Supported by its core drive of keeping people in touch with their world; ONLINE always brings innovative products and services to Cambodia, thus keeping Cambodia abreast with latest technologies worldwide.

Our uniquely tailored services continue to meet the needs of diverse customers – whether for domestic, corporate, single or multiple users, academic or leisure purposes. Online improves communications with the rest of the world through ideal, reliable and secure connection coupled with excellent support services. ONLINE is connected to the world directly through mainland China, Hong Kong, Thailand, European countries, through redundant fiber optic cable making us the most vigorous ISP in Cambodia with abundant and diverse routes around the world.

Our Mission
To deliver technology solutions to achieve superior operational performance that enables us to provide our customers with exceptional service.

Our Vision
To be the primary internet service provider of choice and ideal company that provides fostering work environment.

Job Description:
The Head of Admin & Finance is responsible for all aspects of financial management for BORDA´s regional operation in Southeast Asia, currently overseeing 2 country offices (Cambodia and Lao PDR). Tasks are performed in close coordination with the Regional Director and the project finance team at our headquarters in Bremen, Germany. The Head of Admin & Finance will oversee and coordinate financial activities for the respective donor projects, including Implementation of financial systems, budgeting, expenditure tracking, procurement, grants, logistics, human resources and financial reporting and accounting. The position is also responsible for ensuring cost consciousness, compliance as well as to coordinate and support the admin and finance focal points of BORDA´s country offices within the regional portfolio.

- Minimum Qualification: Bachelor’s degree in finance, or business administration, CPA, CMA, NGO related work experience and accounting software skills in WINPACCS is a plus
- Business Language: English (German skills is a plus)
- Experience Level: Mid to high level 
- Experience Length: Min. of 8 years
- Employment type: Full time
- Duty station: Phnom Penh, Cambodia


** Main responsibilities include, among others:
•	Support the regional office to perform his duties to achieve the regional BORDA objectives 
•	Facilitate and coordinates external, internal, donor or government audits for the regional office and supervise country specific audits
•	Ensure implementation and compliance of donor specific funding regulation across the region
•	Prepare timely and accurate financial reporting based on donor and local government requirements
•	Provide technical and general accounting support to the respective project finance teams in close cooperation with our headquarters in Bremen
•	Track budget/expenses for the projects run by the regional and country offices to ensure proper cash flow and expenditure against the approved budget plans
•	Develop financial reports
Job Requirement:
•	Implement regional admin & finance policies, systems and procedures for the regional office and its country offices
•	Perform internal control audits and compliance checks
•	Assist with the preparation and revision of project or grant proposals (budget review)
•	Ensure that all relevant admin & finance documents are appropriately filed (soft and print copy)
•	Manage and conduct accounting activities, including bookkeeping, in compliance with the accounting and financial procedures of donors in the regional office.
•	Check budget lines to ensure that all transactions are correctly booked to the correct budget lines of the annual budget plan program in alignment with the budget holder. 
•	Coordinate the production of regional staff plans
•	Maintain day-to-day administrative and personnel services to meet legislative requirements and support the overall operations of the regional office, thereby being a point of contact for all employees, providing administrative support and managing staff queries
•	Oversee the opening of new bank accounts in the region
•	Supervise, coordinate, and support the administrative function for the regional office, which includes travel and accommodation 
•	Ensure that appropriate procurement policies and procedures are followed by all country offices
•	Consult legal issues closely with lawyers
•	Supervise the request for installments of the respective country offices

** To apply for the position, please send the following to miller@borda.org
•	Curriculum vitae (CV)
•	Letter of motivation (one-page PDF)
•	At least three traceable references (with referee contact details)
•	Deadline: until position filled
•	Email Subject: APPLICATION FOR HEAD OF ADMIN & FINANCE
•	ONLY APPLICATIONS WITH ALL REQUIREMENTS SUBMITTED WILL BE CONSIDERED
Company Profile: BORDA is a German NGO with operations in more than 15 countries worldwide. BORDA has been active in Cambodia since 2009 – with the aim to improve the living conditions of disadvantaged communities and to keep the environment intact through the expansion of sanitation services in the areas of decentralized sanitation, faecal sludge, solid waste management and holistic livable city planning. We work with local governments and enterprises to improve communal planning processes, sanitary supply structures and services in cities at variety of scales and applications.
Contact Info: Contact Information HR Department    miller@borda.org Phnom Penh.
